intro: Protasparagus pearsonii, commonly known as the Pearson's asparagus, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the United States. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to habitat loss, it is listed as threatened under the Endangered Species Act.
